page.title: 03FISHERY PROTECTION/POLLUTION
page.content: POACHING at sea uses drift netting from small boats.Poaching from the beach happens mainly at Spittal.Nets, with floats at the top and weights at the bottom,are thrown in by hand.A brick or a bottle is on the end of the net. PROTECTION: water bailiffs have patrolled the Tweed since 1857.They use a boat and four-wheel-drive vehicles.There is also a navy protection vessel which patrols from Dunbar to Holy Island.A light aircraft is also used to patrol the area. POLLUTION on the Tweed is kept low by the Tweed Purification Board and the Northumbrian Water Authority.The main sources of pollution are leaks from defective silage clamps.A problem through the summer is the rapid growth of water crowfoot,encouraged by the nitrogen in run-off from fertilisers.
